channel.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
channel.description:
Please browse this thread before making a help topic about VPS's. Your question may be in here!
Also, feel free to suggest good places to get a VPS at, and I will make up a list for people to see to help them decide where to obtain their VPS.
[url=http://www.webhostingtalk.com/showthread.php?t=621002]What to look for in a VPS[/url] [url=http://www.webhostingtalk.com/showthread.php?t=466323]Understanding what a VPS is[/url] [url=http://www.openna.com/pdfs/John_Holbrook_GSEC.pdf]Setting up a basic LAMP[/url]
[b]Reputable VPS providers[/b] ([i]Will update[/i]) [url=http://burst.net/linvps.shtml]Burst.net[/url] - Linux plans start at $5.95 [url=http://x10vps.com]x10vps[/url] - Linux plans starting at 7.95 (I have personally used this one myself, it's pretty good -- Evil_) [url=http://www.hostv.com/vps-hosting.shtml]Hostv[/url] - Linux plans start at $19.99 [url=http://www.wiredtree.com/managedvps/]Wiredtree[/url] - [b]Managed[/b] plans start at $49.99 [url=http://www.wooservers.com]WooServers[/url] - Linux and Windows VPS's with great support and prices (Or you can use [url=http://helpdesk.wooservers.com/aff.php?aff=035]deathschaos9's referral link[/url])
[b]Places to look for VPS providers[/b] [url=http://www.webhostingtalk.com/forumdisplay.php?f=104]Webhostingtalk[/url] - One of the most active web hosting boards, A perfect place to search for providers and reviews. [url=http://www.google.co.uk/webhp?hl=en#hl=en&xhr=t&q=linux+vps+hosting&cp=10&pf=p&sclient=psy&safe=off&site=webhp&source=hp&aq=0&aqi=&aql=&oq=linux+vps+&pbx=1&fp=8fe4bc1dc511388d]Google

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

I just got a vps over 24hrs ago with VPSIsland and its only given me login stuff for the customer portal and when I click on services it sends to a tab that says “web Hosting” and the status is still pending…Is it normal to be taking this long? Is this the right thing I need or do I need to get something else? All I want too do is host my server online

Read full topic
item.source: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

item.description:
@Vikingman12 wrote:

Looking for a site I can purchase a VPS to run about 50 people on … Idk where to look.

Edit- Do not trust x10 VPS! I purchased a VPS and they sent me info for my VPS, but it’s not working … And they have not responded to any of my attempts to reach out to them.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
item.dc:creator: @almw almw
item.description:
@almw wrote:

Hello everyone,

I have had a idea for my RSPS to be hosted on a vps because I can’t keep running my computer 24/7 so I need to find a reasonable priced VPS for hosting. Could you please recommend me what site to go on as I really need this to start my RSPS once again.

My budget is $10-$24

Kind regards,
Antonio Warren

Read full topic
item.source: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

mista pnut:

Also, a good tip is to make sure that the VPS company you are using will allow Runescape/Runescape Private servers to be hosted on the VPS’. I’ve ran in to a company that wouldn’t allow it and didn’t know it until after I had paid for one. Always ask support, it’s the quickest way to find out (but will also be found in the Terms of Service).

uh, generally, hosting a rsps server isn’t technically legal so about 100% (and that’s a rough estimate) of all vps providers won’t allow rsps to be hosted

Read full topic
item.source: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

No love for Linode? They’re pricy, but it’s completely worth it. Extremely fast, extremely stable, amazing support, amazing panel. I currently have two servers from then, one for a general community and a personal one as a VPN.

Read full topic
item.source: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I’m changing this topic from a required place to post VPS questions to a suggested place. People are just not getting the answers for specific problems they need (and some are not even relevant to the VPS itself) because the question doesn’t get the attention of its own thread.

Read full topic
item.source: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

@mista_pnut wrote:

Also, a good tip is to make sure that the VPS company you are using will allow Runescape/Runescape Private servers to be hosted on the VPS’. I’ve ran in to a company that wouldn’t allow it and didn’t know it until after I had paid for one. Always ask support, it’s the quickest way to find out (but will also be found in the Terms of Service).

item.source: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Hi, so I’m developing a private server (see signature) and I am using a blog to post my developments and making money via Google AdSense to buy a host.

I’ve just started receiving valid clicks from AdSense, so wanted to shop around and see what price I should aim for, and what type of host I should buy. I have no experience with this, I’ve even no idea how to set it up once I get it (will cross that bridge when it comes), so I was wondering if you could tell me your experiences about types of hosts (VPS, Dedicated etc.), and which reliable companies you used, so that I can get some sort of idea of what I should be looking for.

Read full topic
item.source: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!

item.title: VPS Information - Please read before posting a VPS question!
item.dc:creator: @DevotionPk DevotionPk
item.description:
@DevotionPk wrote:

Just bought a windows vps, Connected to it with Windows Remote Desktop Connection.
Installed java and all other programs.

Then i took my Client changed all the spots to my VPS IP, tryed it on my PC and couldn’t connect.

How to fck can i Put it online on my vps, its automaitcly port forwarded right? or do i have to open port 5555 or port 43594 anywhere? in my firewall?

Read full topic
